content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a bit on the harder end of clash of code puzzles, but I liked it!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's an easy but not trivial contribution, by an author who seems to be putting the effort.

Hi, I have a few minor suggestions:

* One of the guidelines reads "Don't address the reader directly" - the first paragraph could be changed to conform to this (but, to be honest, other contributions also disregard this guideline).

*  As the draws are independent, their order is not relevant, so the following can be misleading: "they occurred in the exact order observed", since that's _not_ what you're asking to be calculated. This is somewhat corrected in the "Note" found later on in the text, but still should be substituted by something along the lines of "You decide to observe the sequence of draws and calculate its probability (see note bellow)." 

*  Add "s" in Input: A list of string ->  A list of strings 

* "on" -> "to" and "draw" -> "draws" in "corresponding on the successive draw made"

you have C and c like the same variable(in Goal and Input)... i think it must be all C (upper) or al c (lower).

why all color test is with only four colors when number of colors C is between 1 and 6? it's not bad but consistency is good :)

Goal
* Please change "is represented by [[mc]] balls" to "has a specific count [[mc]], representing the number of balls of that color".

* Please add "Each entry in [[T]] is the color of the ball drawn." after "that occurred."

Input
* Line 1: Please change "int" to "integer".

* Please add "<<Line 2 :>> An integer [[C]] for the number of ball colors".

* Next C lines:
  • Please format "C" as a [[variable]].

  • Please format "," as a {{constant}}.

  • Please change "its number of balls" to "the number of balls in that color".
  
  • Please change "int" to "integer".

* Last line:
  • Please format "T" as a [[variable]].
  
  • Please format "," as a {{constant}}.

Output
* Please change "this draw" to "this series of draws".

* Please change "with up to 4 digits after the decimal point" to "rounded to 4 decimal places".

* Please format "Error" as a {{constant}}.

Constraints
* Please change both "0"s to 1.

* Please change "len([[T]])" to "number of colors in [[T]]", because len([[T]]) is ambiguous (may mean number of elements in [[T]] or the length of [[T]] as a string).

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar. Please split each of the current cases into a pair, e.g.

Test 1: Simple
Validator 1: Simple #
Test 2: Not equal - Less
Validator 2: Not equal - less #
(etc.)

# = inputs should be similar but different when compared with corresponding test

Thanks.
Thank you for your advises, i will change that !

The 6 colors were because I decided beforehand, but it's true that during my tests, I never went to so many colors. For C and c, maybe I'll have to come up with another name, I'll think about it. Thanks for your comment!
(Sorry for the delay in replying)
Thanks for your feedback, I'll make the changes you suggested!

Thank you for following up!

Cases
* Not Equal - More # (Validator): There are two lines of "Red" balls in the input. Please revise one of them.

* Please note that you don't have to add the "#" mark to the names, but it's ok to leave the names unchanged now. (I added "#" for the convenience of my explanation only.)

* Please note that you don't have to make the output exactly the same in each pair of cases (only similarity is required), but it's ok to leave the cases unchanged now.

Thanks.
